intro: Nauclea parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved nauclea, is a tropical shrub native to Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or yellowish flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. Nauclea parvifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
